citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Fenbendazole was stored with the medications, had an expiration date of 05-2024 and had been used for a litter of
puppies in July 2024 for deworming. The use of expired medications might not protect the animals it is used on as
intended. Ensure that expired medications are properly discarded and not used on regulated animals.
***To be corrected from 10/2/2024 forward.

The current written Exercise Program was approved/signed by the previous attending veterinarian (AV). To ensure dogs
are provided adequate space and exercise per the AV's guidance, a written exercise program must be approved by the
current AV. Ensure that a written exercise program is reviewed and approved by the current AV.
***Correct by November 8, 2024.

The facility has an attending veterinarian with regularly scheduled visits that has oversight of the medical care of the
animals and has completed physical exams of each dog, however the written program of veterinary care (PVC) that was
developed and signed by the current attending veterinarian (AV) was not available for inspection. A written PVC that is
signed by the current AV is required and is important for the facility to be have as a resource for care questions such as
but not limited to vaccine and deworming schedules. Ensure to obtain and maintain a written PVC that is signed and
approved by the current AV.
***Correct by November 8, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Fenbendazole was stored with the medications, had an expiration date of 05-2024 and had been used for a litter of 
puppies in July 2024 for deworming. The use of expired medications might not protect the animals it is used on as 
intended. Ensure that expired medications are properly discarded and not used on regulated animals.  
***To be corrected from 10/2/2024 forward. 
3.8 
   
Exercise for dogs. 
The current written Exercise Program was approved/signed by the previous attending veterinarian (AV). To ensure dogs 
are provided adequate space and exercise per the AV's guidance, a written exercise program must be approved by the 
current AV. Ensure that a written exercise program is reviewed and approved by the current AV.  
***Correct by November 8, 2024. 
3.13(a) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility has an attending veterinarian with regularly scheduled visits that has oversight of the medical care of the 
animals and has completed physical exams of each dog, however the written program of veterinary care (PVC) that was 
developed and signed by the current attending veterinarian (AV) was not available for inspection. A written PVC that is 
signed by the current AV is required and is important for the facility to be have as a resource for care questions such as 
but not limited to vaccine and deworming schedules. Ensure to obtain and maintain a written PVC that is signed and 
approved by the current AV.  
***Correct by November 8, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
 n
